tiles.name: old_delhi_red_fort_district
tiles.description: Home to the iconic Red Fort, this district buzzes with tourists and echoes with Mughal grandeur.

tiles.name: chandni_chowk_spice_market
tiles.description: The heart of Old Delhi, a chaotic labyrinth of spice stalls, food vendors, and bustling crowds, Shreyansh's home.

tiles.name: daryaganj_book_market
tiles.description: A sprawling Sunday book market, offering a treasure trove of literary finds amidst a sea of vendors and bargain hunters.

tiles.name: jama_masjid_neighborhood
tiles.description: Centered around the majestic Jama Masjid mosque, this area is a hub of Islamic culture and culinary delights.

tiles.name: kashmere_gate_isbt_area
tiles.description: A major transportation hub, connecting Delhi to the rest of India through its bustling inter-state bus terminal.

tiles.name: civil_lines_colonial_district
tiles.description: Once the heart of British administration, this area boasts colonial-era architecture and wide, tree-lined avenues.

tiles.name: new_delhi_railway_station_zone
tiles.description: A perpetually crowded railway station, a gateway to the city for millions of travelers.

tiles.name: paharganj_backpacker_district
tiles.description: A haven for budget travelers, offering cheap accommodations, quirky shops, and a vibrant international vibe.

tiles.name: rajghat_memorial_area
tiles.description: The serene memorial to Mahatma Gandhi, a place of reflection and remembrance.

tiles.name: yamuna_river_floodplains

tiles.name: old_delhi_walled_city_remnants
